Reviews.Title: I don't know what all the fuss is about
Reviews.Author: Charles W. Long
Reviews.Content: I read the negative review about the bad imaging experienced with this camera. Well, yesterday I got the camera and went about taking some test shots to check for the indicated problems. If verified, I intended to box it up and send it back. I had sort of made a mistake when ordering it, and actually thought I was ordering another Fuji model that had more favorable reviews.Anyway, I took a bunch of pictures using many of the special features available with the camera. I was particularly attentive to shots taken at or near maximum zoom and closeups using the macros. I intentionally was a bit careless taking several shots of distinct objects using maximum zoom-- the results were most pleasing; only a couple of the 3 dozen shots were blurred. I also took aim at three of my neighborhood dog-friends who never stand still and the camera rendered them absolutely rigid. So, I rate the image stabilization as very good. The close-ups were also surprisingly good and I didn't bother with using a tripod or anything else to take the shots.So, I have trashed the box and will keep the camera.  It does a super job with the things I want it to do. Ansel Adams may have insisted upon something better, but I am very pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: The best quality for the least money
Reviews.Author: Geezer "mizbooks"
Reviews.Content: This is the most versatile camera for the most reasonable amount of money I've ever had.  Photography is a hobby for me, not a profession, so I want to be able to experiment with manual control, yet point and shoot with the family and pets so pictures will be spontaneous instead of posed.  There is nothing wanting in the quality of the images.  While the materials may be lighter than most high-end cameras, that's very much what I like about it.  It's well-made, if almost TOO small, and you don't feel like you're dragging around a boat anchor all day.  I have a more expensive "prestigious" camera, but may as well sell it for all the use it gets, because this is the one I use all the time.

Reviews.Title: A Bridge Camera at Near Compact Price
Reviews.Author: Rajendra S. Gondhalekar
Reviews.Content: I was looking to replace the crappy Vivitar compact we bought a couple years ago.  That camera just would not lock autofocus onto anything in compact florescent lighting, and was very finicky to focus in natural light as well.  I wanted to get something better than a compact, and after a little bit of looking, settled onto the FujiFilm S2550HD.  I have used it for a few days now, and am very happy to report that the results are very good.I loved:-18x zoom lens-quickly locking auto focus-robust selection of pre-built modes (which is how my wife will use it)-the ability to go into manual everything (which is where I will likely be living)-accurate color capture in outdoor daylight settings and the ability to do manual white balance in other lighting just in case the presets are off-usage of cheap AA cells and support for vanilla SDHC cards-bright and big 3" LCD and an electronic viewfinder when the light was too bright to use the LCD  (this is where the other manufacturers have cut features)I did not particularly like:-only two aperture settings to select from-results at high ISO settings were too noisy to be very useful-lens cap was not threaded preventing attaching any filters or accessories-only the basic manual in the box, when the full manual would have cost pennies more to include insteadI haven't tried using it for video shooting yet, but it's a good ability to have in a pinch to take some clips. The price is what sold me as well, as this model provided features that were much more in line with other bridge cameras that sold for more money.  I also seriously looked at some entry level DSLR models, but could not justify the fact that I would have had to spend at least twice as much, to just get started down that path.  This one versatile camera should serve us quite well compared to the alternatives during our family vacations.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Tucker
Reviews.Content: I mostly bought this camera for the 18x zoom feature; the most zoom for the money I found and though I never owned a fuji camera, I figured the Fuji was at least a pretty good camera. Was I ever shocked at the features it has for the price. I does everything and does it well. It had a ton of features and looked complicated to use at first but is one of the easiest cameras to set up and use that I've had. Just have to learn a few buttons to use it. The design of everything on the camera in ingenious, everything is exactly where it should be, easy to reach while using and feels like a real camera, not a toy. This model has a red light beam to target the subject when shooting in dark or low light situations; this can mean the difference in getting a good photo in a dark room when there is not enough light to see the subject in the display. You don't have to look at the display, press the shutter button all the way down and release, put the red beam on the subject and the camera will do the rest without you having to look at the display at all. It will give you enough time to line up your shot before taking the photo. I've gotten many more good pics using this.  The only negatives I found about the camera is that the lens cap ocasionally falls off and the strapis a little on the cheap side; it got so twisted up I removed it. The camera itself overcomes the complaint here and a replacement strap is cheap.  The camera is good enough to use professionally, within it's abilities, and there is no way to  beat this one for the price; it has many features of cameras costing much more. If I were a pro needing to use the high priced cameras they use, this Fuji would be my backup. This one's a deal.

Reviews.Title: BETTER THAN A DSLR
Reviews.Author: mars198 "photomars"
Reviews.Content: After owning several dslr cameras I wanted something to take quick pictures and videos of the family.  This camera exceeds my expectations.  The picture quality is excellent.  The camera focuses quickly and provides more zoom than you will ever reasonably need.  The video quality is also excellent and you can switch modes from pictures to video with  just a few clicks of the control dial.  The camera is not a dslr but the picture quality is on par with 90% of what you get from a dslr.  Most people don't need a dslr they have just been convinced that they do.The camera is not a substitute for a video camera.  But if you need to take one device that can shoot excellent pictures and decent video - this is a great choice.  I used the camera last week to video a children's program at my church.  We showed the video Sunday on our 20 foot projection screen.  The video and sound were great.If I were a professional photographer I of course would not use this camera for my professional work.  This camera is excellent at what it is designed to be.  It is a great all around camera and video camera.  The battery life is also great.  I have been using the same set for the last week, with no indications of a low battery.  I highly recommend the camera.  OK - the lens cap is not very good - it just falls off.  But that is the only fault I can find.

Reviews.Title: If you have half a brain, you'll love this camera
Reviews.Author: PJinPhotogSchool
Reviews.Content: Having seen a few negative reviews for this camera, I have to admit that I was a bit worried about ordering it. I took solace in the fact I could return it if it was as poor as some thought and ordered it based on the listed features. I was not disappointed! The camera has worked great so far and I've had it for about 3 weeks. I use it almost everyday.This is not a typical point and shoot. You may have to do some of the work yourself, and learning how to get the auto focus to work is key. (It is simple, just a half press of the shutter and it will focus). This camera gives you more control but you just have to learn to use it. If you are not willing to learn, the auto features still work very well. I take most of my pics with one of the auto settings and I love the results for the most part.You can't beat these features for this price

Reviews.Title: Fuji Finepix S2550
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Livshiz
Reviews.Content: Over all, I am very happy with this camera. For the money, I think it is an excellent purchase. It takes great pics, is very intuitive to use (I have yet to open the manual and I've had the camera for a few weeks now), and has many great features.My only two complaints are that, one, sometimes it takes a little work to get the lighting and focus just right on the object you are trying to capture. And two, the zoom motor makes a pretty loud, course sounding noise that shows up clear as day in a video when being used. It's loud enough to drown out people talking to the person operating the camera.That being said, I love the 18X zoom lens. It is awesome. And I love the overall look, feel, and size of the thing.I'm by no means a pro photographer, I just like to take pictures now and again. For someone like me, this camera is perfect. And for only [...] bucks, it's a steal. I would imagine that to get anything better would require purchasing an SLR and spending at least 3 times that much. I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Fine Little Fuji
Reviews.Author: Ben Windham
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement for my wife's older Fuji FinePix 3800, which was a workhorse for many years.The S2550 is a good step up, similar to operate, yet with many more 'bells and whistles'.Only complaint: camera "wakes up" in Wide Angle mode.  I would rather have it start in 'Normal' lens position.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: festor
Reviews.Content: I researched cameras for about 3 months and finally decided on the Fuji. You would be hard pressed to find a camera of this quality with the features it has in any other camera especially for the price. I looked at many reviews and feedbacks and there was very little negative commentary on it. The lens cap does not stay on well but if you forget to take it off when you turn the camera on, it comes off itself which has already saved some pictures for me. We just got back from vacation and took about 700 pictures with it. Just let the camera choose the setting and you will be impressed. A high speed card is a must due to the size of the pictures, especially if you want to do the rapid shots. Very few shortcomings on this camera, but the positives definitely outweigh those.

Reviews.Title: great item
Reviews.Content: i read other people's reviews before buying. i realized, one should never trust other people's reviews. I personally like this camera. it's simple in operation, great exterior, fine video quality. Recommend this camera to anybody, who goes on special occasions (restuarants, parties, picnics) because it's easy to carry compared to any SLR camera and it's not that expensive in case of falls or stealing.

Reviews.Title: Fuji S2550
Reviews.Author: D. A. Hanson "Carver10"
Reviews.Content: thepicture quality is very good. Close-ups of flowers show every fine detail.zoom works very smoothly.A+A+A+A+

Reviews.Title: its okay.
Reviews.Author: Juliann Loomis
Reviews.Content: not the best camera ever. obviously because of the price. It does the job but doesnt do all of the work for you, so if you want to get good pictures you have to know how to work the settings and know how to take photographs at least academically i think. I bought this for a photography class and its fine for it. Would be a good camera if you wanted it for personal use, for taking family photos and what not. My only huge problem with it is that there is no manual focus and it has a hard time focusing in low light situations. The flash is fine but the photos get blown out really easily in really dark situations. Honestly, you get what you pay for with this camera. If i had more money at the time i would have definitely gone for a canon or nikon but i went the cheap route and i understood that the quality wouldnt be as good. sooo overall... decent for the price.

Reviews.Title: long time fuji owner
Reviews.Author: Ichabod Mudd "Ichabod mudd"
Reviews.Content: I have lots of cams.  Even some old Nikon's.but my S602z is a best comparison. old verses new.i'll get the con's done first.1: lens cap will not stay put, no latch. a real pain that is!!2: no way to mount a filter on cam, S602 has an adapter for that, what does a thread cost 1 cent?  I run a sky light filter to protect lens. but can't now.3 that silly side port of rubber, what is that?  it just gets in the way when connected to USB. I miss that hinged cover , 10 cents. wow.Pros.it shoots as good as my S602. fast , and very good auto focus. and for those that expect auto-focus to be magic, you need to be happy it works so good.The poster that said the LCD was grainy, my gosh man that is feature. it takes the CCD up to max gain so you can see in the dark. Gosh !my 602 shows black LCD in same lighting ! (even though if smarter I could do the view) what's better black or grainy? dah.what is happening here, is the preview allows all AMP. gains (all ISO) on the CCD during this mode. but there is no light.!  Genius way to do that, thanks FUJI.!!Over all I like it , no more hidden side buttons, macro on front now.Dont like missing zoom buttons, now moved to power switch, not at all. but. who's fussy.It is smaller and lighter.Same power flash.Great fill flash.And HD if you need it.didn't try video because , I have nice Sony for that.One CAN fool the focus on ANY camera made ,but this one works as good a I have ever seen! ( and i do expect alot)one trick I use,is to carry a flash light and shine it on dim objects and the focus seems to wake up. (this is art ,no?)and MACRO mode,  very nice.happy trails. to all.

Reviews.Title: Short battery life but nice pictures
Reviews.Author: whg
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to take on a recent trip to Europe. We liked the idea that it took standard AA batteries so that we wouldn't have to worry about charging a lithium ion every night. Very disappointed in how short the battery life is. Luckily, we carried extra batteries with us because the camera didn't even make it through an entire day.Other than that, we are happy with the camera. Without a tripod, it is very difficult to take clear pictures with the 18x zoom, even with the stabilizer feature.The camera is pretty compact and easy to carry around. The color in the images is great. The range of available features is also great for a camera of this price.If you want something between a point-and-shoot and an SLR, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Finepix S2550
Reviews.Author: G. Thiele
Reviews.Content: from all the "small / entry level" cameras I had - this is the best. battery live is great - about 250 pictures on a set of 4. I would replace this model with a bigger brother in the next year.

Reviews.Title: I love my FujiFinePix S2550!
Reviews.Author: Karen A. Wittman
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera and am completely happy with my purchase.  A very reasonably priced digital camera with an awesome zoom lens, multi-frame photos, macro and HD Video.  I'm not much on reading the manual, so I'm still figuring out all the different options and settings but have found it to be rather intuitive and easy to use.  I've gotten some great action shots of my kids playing soccer and doing gymnastics.  An excellent buy!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S2550 12 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: George T. Sumner "Tow Shooter 1"
Reviews.Content: Extremely Good buy. Low Price, great pictures but a little slow focusing. If allowed to completely focus by allowing focus grid to come up. it makes great pictures. I use this camera at night under sodium vapor lights and it takes very good pictures. These Pictures may be seen at [...] on the fishing tournaments pages. "By George"

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Helio F. V. Dias
Reviews.Content: I do recommend this camera for those who want a professional quality, paying a non professional price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: David Farber
Reviews.Content: This camera is an incredible value given what it does. PERFECT intermediate digital camera. 18x zoom has taken my hobby to a new level. And a great camera for intermediate users to ease into more manual shots and less auto shots. Either way Fuji has made a fine product. No complaints. And best panorama function than any other camera i've used at twice the price. Get it and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Tim D.
Reviews.Content: The camera was purchased as used, but aside from not arriving in the original packaging, I couldn't tell it wasn't new.  I still haven't figured out everything operating mode, there is a lot to this camera, but it's easy enough for my kids to use the automatic settings and take great pics!  The battery life could be a little better, but thus far I love the camera!

Reviews.Title: New Finepix
Reviews.Author: singleactionjackson
Reviews.Content: Wanted to replace my wifes old Finepix because she always wants to ZOOM in on whatever she shoots.  This camera has 18X zoom and she is having fun ZOOMING everything and actually getting a closeup of her target.  The usual complaint about the lens cover falling off but I think if thats all thats negative we can live with that.  Overall for the price (this is actually half the price I paid for my old Finepix camera) this camera is a good value.

Reviews.Title: Very good point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Kenny B
Reviews.Content: Got this On Christmas day, threw in a PNY 8GB optimum card (class 4) and shot away. Good photos in all scenarios so far, bright snow backfill, low light w/wo flash etc. Will update after get a chance to use on a sunny day.Yes the video is noisy but I would only use the video on this If I didnt have access to my Everio.Wish the barrel was threaded so could add UV filter. Only other (minor) complaint is the menus are somewhat cumbersome to navigate. Otherwise I could not be happier. This replaces my old Fuji S3000 which was an excelent camera for my needs.One more thing, persons expecting DLSR results from a camera this inexpensive need to get a grip.

Reviews.Title: Fuji FinePix S2550  camera
Reviews.Author: James K. Beard
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix S2550 12 MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 3-Inch LCD GReat little camera for more than a simple 'point and shoot' camera and yet not too difficult for a neophyte to handle.

Reviews.Title: Just right for the price!
Reviews.Author: James Tullier
Reviews.Content: The camera has performed flawlessly on my trip to the UK. I especially like the Panorama setting which allows you to take as many as three interlocking pictures from right to left and let the camera combine them into a beauitful panorama that would not be possible with a single shot.  It is simple to operate, having all the shooting modes on a thumb wheel right on top. There is even a snap shot mode that automatically adjusts the camera for different shooting conditions. I have not completely explored all the features, but I am very satisfied with this model.

Reviews.Title: FUJI digital
Reviews.Author: Maura Pavlock
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for QUICK pictures...  The pictures are wonderful!  light weight yet ready for the big job!  I love the cable that came with it..  I can download pictures at work.My biggest downfall is that it KILLS the batteries quickly! I also dont care for deleting the pictures one at a time!  I am still playing with it!

Reviews.Title: Good results with patience, but could be better
Reviews.Author: Andrew Rabon
Reviews.Content: Some thoughts on it since I've had mine since July:Pros:- High resolution makes 70% of pictures extremely crisp, and it captures text documents and flowers perfectly (when using the right settings)- High amount of settings but I only use "SP" Scene Position, which has presets for Party, Night, Natural, Text, Flowers, Sport, etc.- Panorama (splices three horizontal photos into one) pics usually come out great if used on nature and not man-made stuff- Built-in ability to rotate images and correct red eye, among others, are very usefulCons:- Video capture, although 1080p HD, is extremely poor and (even more annoyingly) extremely space-consuming. A couple seconds will gobble up over 100 MB easily. Sound is oftentimes painful since it has only one mic and no wind cancellation, and the picture is usually completely grainy- In even somewhat dim lighting, pics turn out grainy, blurred, or bothI'm most disappointed with the video capture, it's almost entirely unusable due to both the abhorrent quality and the amount of space it uses (Motion-JPEG as a codec belongs in the 20th century), but the majority of my pictures give satisfy my quality standards. Some come out too dark, in fact lighting is an issue with this camera in general, but the flash is always there if you need it.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S2550 12.2 MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 3-Inch
Reviews.Author: bnk
Reviews.Content: Only used camera one time and it took really good pictures. Zoom works goods. I cannot figure out how to combine the folders in the software. Evertime you take pictures it puts them in different folders and then it will not let you combine them into 1 folder

Reviews.Title: satisfying camea
Reviews.Author: L. Baker "JeepinJK"
Reviews.Content: My 2550 is a replacement for a worn out samsung s860 from that was good for what my original need but as those photography situations got more advanced it couldn't keep up. The 2550 masters the low light as long as it isn't almost completely dark outside. The flash makes the pictures look cheesy and cellphone camera like but as I said, low light function in manual is good.Of course in daylight the 2550 does very good. The CCD image quality is actually in many ways better than my CMOS HS20exr (also a fujifilm). The build quality of the 2550 is great and is relatively water-resistant.Example: when I take pictures of waterfalls where the water vapor and condensation are horrific, the camera hasn't died yet. Sometimes the water is so thick it completely covers the lens. I don't recommend doing this to your 2550 because you might not be as lucky as I was.The zoom feature is very useful and allows me to take picture from a long distance. The only downfall is the fact that 18x plus the digital zoom is not enough to reach some objects that you can still see. This has happened to me before and is extremely annoying. That is one of the many reasons why I have upgraded to the HS20exr, with almost double the zoom, I usually don't use all 720 millimeters of the focal length but when I do I feel happy that I have it. Another thing about the zoom feature is the fact it has a very noisy motor. When you are taking video it is quieter but the zoom still makes a buzzing sound when you zoom the video in. You can hear it in playback as a loud buzzing, over all of the static in the bad mono microphone. I rarely use the video function in the s2550 for that reason. It's 720p HD but nothing more.The only other complaint I have is the fact that the camera is slow, especially compared to the HS20exr. It has missed moments before because it's so slow turning on, autofocusing, and taking pictures. 6 seconds to turn on, autofocus, and take picture. If you want a picture of a bird the 2550 will allow it to fly away, reach the next state, and have babies.Over all though my 2550 is satisfactory and since it isn't my primary camera any more I don't get as annoyed with it's downfalls. I love my 2550 and it has made me a fujifilm loyalist.

Reviews.Title: Fine camera
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera for the money. Two things not mentioned so far, there is a digital zoom on the camera(tripod use only), you can zoom while taking videos(motor noise is loud). I have used this camera enough to know that it is only as good as the driver. There is a lot to understand about how it works. Most of the time I have used it in Auto mode. It takes good low light pictures, although some pics are greenish(must learn to adjust the white balance). Must use rechargeable batteries(I use hybrid or pre-charged types) or you will go broke quickly.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Value.
Reviews.Author: DZ302
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 13 year old daughter who was interested in photography.  She likes it very much, uses it often, and has been very creative with it.  If you want a good camera with enough usable features and not spend too much, this is a good option.  It is easy to use and the price and shipment from Amazon was excellent.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: Jack Miehoff "Slammin Jack"
Reviews.Content: Bought this product for a christmas gift for my wife, and she absolutely loves it, I was a little skeptical at first because the price is so low.  But WOW!  this thing is deffinately worth more than what they sell it for.  Some of the pics she has taken seem like a PRO did them.. I recommend this camera to anyone that doesn't mind toting around a bigger size camera.

Reviews.Title: Great gift
Reviews.Author: Longanecker
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my mother in law to upgrade from her standard point and shoot. This is a great mid-range camera for someone wanting more options than a standard point and shoot but doesn't want to pay for a DSLR with interchangeable lenses. Mother in law was very happy and began using the camera as soon as she took it out of the box.

Reviews.Title: 2010 Christmas gift! Its Cool!
Reviews.Author: Q.Michelle
Reviews.Content: I was shocked when i first received the camera, Love the EVF and LCD reviewing.When shooting the camera is a bit slow but takes great pictures!Panarama is HOT!! I love how it shows you where you left off so you can aline the pictures correctly; so that made made it easy for me, a person thats not camera smart!Im still learning all the features but as soon as I get to know my new camera I will post another review!Overall I love it! Easy to manage, great for a person whos not into all the different buttons and fancy gadgets that makes things complicated!

Reviews.Title: Fuji Finepix
Reviews.Author: Butch
Reviews.Content: Great camera, excellent features for this price range. I especially like the HDMI output to view pictures and videos in HD.

Reviews.Title: Fujiflims Finepix S2550 12mp
Reviews.Author: Dougeedee
Reviews.Content: This camera is everything I hoped for, it works just like it is suppose to. Great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Wife-picked camera
Reviews.Author: David A. Jacob "Dave the Boss"
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera because it was lighter then other cameras and it does alot of the things I wants a camera to do. Takes really nice pictures and so far to not real hard to operate. Having 18x zoom is also very nice.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Gregory Turner "Fat Cat"
Reviews.Content: Really like this camera, wasnt quite sure at first but after learning some of the functions i can use it very well and quickly change settings.  The tilting screen is a asset, that is really useful when taking pictures low or high,(of a walking toddler) as you dont have to bend right over to see the screen.  Picture quality turns out good. Great camera.

Reviews.Title: FinePix S2550
Reviews.Author: Frederick W. Rembetski
Reviews.Content: Great Camera, easy to use.  Only 1 problem...lousy lens cover..poorly fitted andwill not stay attached.

Reviews.Title: An OK picture taker but with design and quality shortcomings
Reviews.Author: S. Diamond "book addict"
Reviews.Content: While the features on the Fujifilm Finepix S2550 look impressive, the camera is in many ways an unsatisfactory piece of equipment because of shortcomings in design and quality. To build a bridge camera with 18X optical zoom, HD video capability, a large LCD screen plus viewfinder, yet sell for less than $250, (the list price, but considerably less on Amazon) Fujifilm had to cut a few corners. The first cost savings was to rely on user supplied 4 AA batteries (the camera comes with 4 alkaline  batteries). That adds bulk and weight to the camera but saves Fujifilm the cost of a lithium battery and charger. Users have complained about the flimsy lens cover. The way the zoom lens is designed it cannot take a sturdy lens cover or even a filter for protection. The lens is recessed within a front cylinder or barrel. When the camera is turned on the lens moves out of the cylinder and pushes anything in front out of its away, such as the lens cover. The lens cover is a cheesy piece of flexible plastic, which barely stays put when the camera is not in use. A filter or a more secure, lens cover could damage the lens as it moves out when the camera is turned on. This inconvenient type of lens design for this large zoom only makes sense because it probably saves Fujifilms something in manufacturing costs. The CD has two pieces of software, one of which Fuji has not been bothered to upgrade to Windows 7. Other cost savings have to do with the potential durability of camera parts, as they do not always have a quality feel or show an attention to detail. For example, the battery cover has to hold down 4 relatively large batteries compared to a lithium one, but it doesn't seem to have the heft to last and keep doing the job over the life of the camera. The cover for the cable inputs is even more flimsy: it doesn't have a full hinge holding it to the camera when opened, but only a sliver of plastic. The camera takes an HDMI cable for transferring video to a TV, but you need to find a compatible one on your own. Finally. don't be seduced by the camera specs. The LCD screen is OK, but not the sharpest of brightest. The viewfinder is hard to use in low light. The 18X zoom loses resolution, aperture and stability as you get closer to its upper limits.  The biggest selling point for this camera is its street price. It now sells on Amazon for less than $190, a sharp reduction since it was first introduced some months ago. If you want a bridge camera with better design and quality, look at the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ35. But it costs about $100 more than the S2550. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Adeqaute, Not Great; OK for family use
Reviews.Author: White Oak
Reviews.Content: I've down rated this camera to only 3 stars because it is slow to respond and quick to auto shut-off.I purchased this camera for a wildlife safari so the zoom was the critical factor in purchasing.  I was sorely disappointed in in how quickly the auto shut-off engaged and how slowly the camera responded to "on."  It was also slow to focus and frequently re-focused when there was no need causing me to lose shots.  Also, you have to hit the the shutter button to turn off playback mode rather than just hitting the playback button again.  It's just awkward.  The panorama feature was kind of fun, though I would have preferred the automatic panorama rather than having to take and line up 3 pictures.  That gets difficult to do especially with all the icons in the way.  I couldn't find a way to get rid of the icons. It takes fine pictures just like any other 12 mg pixel so, if you're just doing family photos and such, there are plenty of other cameras that will do a great job for you.

Reviews.Title: The sale of this item
Reviews.Author: John Hamon
Reviews.Content: I am satisfied with the camara but the main reason I bout it was because of the battery charger that came with it, after recieving the cam I never recieved the charger the called them and the sent me the wrong charger. I then called them back and they told me they do not have a charger for this item and the would be glad to go in on half of any charger I buy and to send the charger they sent me back to them, other than that it appears to be ok.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: john goral
Reviews.Content: I've been using this for over 18 months now. Great camera, great pictures. I couldn't be happier with this product

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: M. Lugo "B-Movie Afficionato"
Reviews.Content: Was pleased as punch with it. Its features provide hours of photographic fun & is very easy to use. Would be a good camera for the novice as well as the seasoned professional.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm finePix S2550
Reviews.Author: Jim Lawrence
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera man, but with this camera, I feel like one.  It is very easy to use, takes great pictures with all the gadgets to do just about anything.

Reviews.Title: Beware used products
Reviews.Author: Fred
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy a camera for my wife for Valentines. She had told me what kind she wanted several months back. I love Amazon. So I put in the details and it says we have 3. The new was about $300. There was a used for $150. It said like new and still had the box. I bought it. When my wife opened the box and started it up, flash wouldn't work and the pictures take 30 seconds each to take. Something was clearly wrong with it.Well, I found out buying used on Amazon isn't the same as eBay. When you buy new on Amazon and you decide for any reason the product isn't what you want, you can send it back.The lady that sold the camera won't talk to me. I put in a Guarantee A to Z claim and haven't heard back from that.Just beware buying this camera used from Amazon. I am out $150 and have to go buy another camera.Just an update. Amazon gave me a full refund. The Guarantee A to Z worked. Thank you Amazon.Amazon is still the greatest!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Fine Pix S2550 12.2
Reviews.Author: Medori4
Reviews.Content: Excelente camara, la recomiendo. Muy buena en las panoramicas. El Zoom es de lo mejor. Consume bateria muy rapido, preferiblemente usar de litio.

Reviews.Title: Very good and affordable digital camera
Reviews.Author: BrankoD
Reviews.Content: Fujifilm FinePix S2550 gives very crisp and clear photos, LCD is large enough and preview is perfect, you can clearly see what your photo is going to look like. Optical zoom is amazing, you can zoom and see details on objects that are quite far away. I have only words of recommendation for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Desert Lover
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money. Has an electronic viewfinder (besides a big LCD display) which is essential when shooting in sunlight - a feature not found much anymore except on SLR and cameras costing much more. Multitudes of shooting modes - go as complex as you want or point and shoot in auto. Beautiful pictures in true colors - even HD. I've been shooting at 5 to 8 but can go to 12 Megs. Exceptionally smooth video. Battery life good and uses AA which are always available. Comfortable to hold - design well thought out. Only wish it featured manual focus but auto has worked just fine. Powerful optical telefoto is nice for distance while still giving a crisp picture. Highly recommended and I do not work for Fuji!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera and HD movie
Reviews.Author: Seamless Web Tech
Reviews.Content: Everything it said it was.  Great.  Zoom is fantastic! Screen is awesome.  Features are many and very good.  You can not go wrong....

Reviews.Title: Not quite what I had hoped
Reviews.Author: B. GREEN
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I have an older Fuji S5100 that I've been using as my primary camera for over 5 years. So it was time for an upgrade. I have nothing but praise for my S5100 over the years.That being said the 2550 (also known as the 2500) has the worse autofocus I have ever used. 100% of the time it would focus on things that weren't anywhere near the center on the picture. And I'm not talking about face detection, I'm talking about it focusing on things like chairs and tables instead of the group of 6+ people sitting behind it!I sent this back since if I wanted a manual focus camea I would have bought one!

Reviews.Title: So disappointed.
Reviews.Author: A. Meadows
Reviews.Content: From the positive reviews and the specs of this camera, I was really excited when I first got it.  I took some practice shots and thought, well, it could be better but chaulked it up to the fact that I was learning to use it.  I used it that weekend with some outside shots that turned out pretty good, but really I got better quality from my old Sony Cybershot -- and it was only a 6 mp.  Of course if the Sony had not finally died on me I would have not have had to search for a replacement.  I still was planning to keep this camera though because it took good pictures for the price.Then, I used the video feature.I have two children in band, and I record a LOT of video.  The first videos I took at my youngest son's game sounded like a broken speaker hanging out of an open car window traveling on the interstate.  There is no other way to describe it.  You could barely hear any music for all the roaring static.  I was unaware of this because I did not plan on clearing the camera until after my oldest son's junior college game the next night.  It was bad enough that the sound was messed up on the first videos, but the videos I took at the next game had no sound at all!  Needless to say I was devastated when I realized that none of those great memories could be shared with relatives and friends who can't attend the performances and depend on me to upload video for them to see.The camera I got was obviously defective.  I've already returned it for a refund.  All I can say about it is that I learned a valuable lesson.  You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Mark Ayash "mark a"
Reviews.Content: I was excited to finally get a decent camera..Arrived today and every picture I took was blurry straight out of the box. When you go to zoom into something it gets so blurry you can't make out the object. Judging by the mixed reviews maybe they have a quality issue and when it works it works well but when it doesn't it's junk...Thanks goodness for amazon, I am returning mine.

Reviews.Title: fuji camera s2550
Reviews.Author: geo
Reviews.Content: very please with purchase. fast delivery,camera is easy to use not to heavy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Sucks for Video
Reviews.Author: fsoulja
Reviews.Content: If you are trying to shoot high quality video...don't buy! Spend the extra money and get the "Canon PowerShot SX20 IS". It sell for about $300+! Anyway it says hd and that is true, but video has very poor poooooor sound quality (loud static, and you can hear the motor it uses to zoom in and out) when you play the video back. This is my second canon and I thought I could save a couple of dollars with the fuji, but it just was not worth it, had to send it back. I am happy with my canon!

Reviews.Title: Do not like this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Bekkster
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I was tired of the typical point and shoot type cameras. There are so many features and great zoom on this camera, so I thought I would love it. I was way wrong. Pictures are extremely blurry!! If you are trying to take a picture on the auto setting, you might as well forget it. I have to leave it set in sport mode to get any decent pictures at all. Even in Sport mode, the pictures are blurry 99% of the time. The few pictures that aren't blurry do look really good and the color and clarity are great. But you have to take about 10 pictures to get one good picture. I will probably be returning this camera and go back to a regular $80 point and shoot camera. I have a friend who is a photographer and even she can't make sense of this camera. All the pics she took with it were blurry as well.. Very frustrating!!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix
Reviews.Author: Geobox
Reviews.Content: Es una muy buena cámara, he usado otras cámaras como Sony o Canon que son muy buenas, pero esta cámara está a la altura de mis expectativas con respecto a su precio.  No tenía experiencia con cámaras fotográficas Fuji, pero ahora me doy cuenta que fue una buena decisión adquirirla.Es necesario leer bien el manual y tener cierto grado de conocimiento para que opere de manera optima, el zoom es adecuado para la mayor parte de actividades familiares, el vídeo es bueno (aunque no lo he utilizado mucho).Creo que esta cámara fotográfica esta a la altura de otras marcas que conocía mejor.  Tomando en cuenta el precio y las especificaciones para las que se requiere.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price, but some errors.
Reviews.Author: Javier Erausquin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera cause I sold my previous S1500 Fujifilm, so i decided to buy this one as an upgrade.Firstly, the camera is very good, you have a wide selection of options to use, and the zoom is amazing.But, there are few things that make this camera not a perfect one. The "HD" Video is terrible, you are always hearing a cracking noise, and the quality is not good. And when you use the flash for taking a picture, then you have to wait more than 2 minutes to can take another one with flash.2 weeks later I return the camera, and get a lumix fz35, it is just an awesome camera

Reviews.Title: good but not the best camera- not Nikon or Sony
Reviews.Author: D. Patel "An Engineer"
Reviews.Content: The camera can not focus correctly in low light.  Fuji still did not overcome the design issues that corrected by Nikon and Sony where comes down to taking good pictures in low light.  The LCD screen is very blurry in the house in night time under normal home lights.  I am not that happy with the camera overall but the pictures are graet in day time...

Reviews.Title: delete function defective?
Reviews.Author: Peggie Holley
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this camera when I tried to delete pictures and it would not work. I called Fuji and they were not really able to help. The customer rep talked me through a reset which did nothing to correct the problem nor did her suggestion to remove the batteries for a few hours and then reinsert. The other problem was when I viewed the pictures I'd taken there was an annoying oscillating box of blue squares in the center of the picture. The Fuji rep said it was trying to delete the picture. I've returned the camera and I'm waiting for my refund. Was this camera defective? Has anyone else had this problem?

Reviews.Title: LCD Screen Defective
Reviews.Author: sabunome
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera and the display seems to be defective.  The image has faint blue static, especially when you move the camera, has a washed-out look, and a horizontal line at the top depending on the viewing circumstances.  The result is that it looks like a low-res. streaming Web image and is impossible to use for taking and evaluating images.  I can't imagine this is functioning properly, but thought others might want to be aware of the potential for a defective unit.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: sureok
Reviews.Content: My first order for this item never arrived, and had a hard time figuring out how to contact seller.  Turns out, seller was Amazon.  It shipped with tracking information, but was unable to really track.  When I phoned Amazon however, they promptly issued refund and shipped replacement.  Amazon CS was great.  Second camera arrived and I am delighted with the clarity, zoom and ease of use.  Worth note, I am a novice at this, so to a more seasoned photographer, this might not meet needs - but for me, it is a great product at a great price.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: emz
Reviews.Content: I'm very happy and satisfied with this camera. The price is really awesome and its a good camera for a beginner and I would definitely recommend this to anyone. The only thing though is that, this camera is a bit smaller in size compared to other slr cameras but it's a pretty good camera !

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, super pictures, great price
Reviews.Author: DrPepper
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera, give you great pictures at a great price. Well worth it as a first camera or a backup.

Reviews.Title: Okay camera
Reviews.Author: Farm Hand "Maxpower"
Reviews.Content: I like the panorama setting, and it takes good pictures with the auto setting. A little slow to get going when you want to shoot quickly. So far mostly indoor pics. Will still test it outdoors when the rain stops...

Reviews.Title: A Big Disappointment
Reviews.Author: J. C. Roebuck Jr.
Reviews.Content: I purchased the S2550HD to replace my Fujifilm A600, a point and shoot 6.3 Mp.  I was particularly interested in the 18x zoom and it's ability to take HD videos.  While outdoor pictures are satisfactory, I don't find them to be any great improvement over the A600. But my first beef is with the indoor pictures.  Using every setting the camera offers, many of the indoor pics turn out blurred and grainy (with or without flash), especially if you use the zoom.  My next beef is with the video.  If you use the HD setting, you had better have a very large SD card because a two minute clip will eat up about 800Mb.  But the worst part of the video is with the sound quality...it SUX!  If the volume recorded is at a normal level, the microphone "barely" picks it up and you have to strain to hear it.  If the volume recorded is loud, then the result is distorted and crackly. Furthermore, if you zoom while taking videos, the result is a very loud screeching sound caused by the lens moving in and out.  Not at all what I had hoped for so I can not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: date stamp
Reviews.Author: lumbie22
Reviews.Content: I have not used the camera very much yet,but what I have learned is the camera does not have a date/time stamp that is put on every photo. The photo editing program that comes with it will allow you to put it on home prints at the time of printing ,but this can become very time consuming. The program will also allow you to go through without printing and place the date stamp on all your photo's ,again very time consuming. So far that is the only negative, BUT TO ME THAT IS A BIG ONE ). If this is not corrected on future models, I would not purchase Fugi again.

Reviews.Title: Good for the money
Reviews.Author: J. Gamez "JDGamez"
Reviews.Content: This a very good camera, very ease to use, and fast to point and shoot. You will be able to shoot 1700 pictures using a 8G flash memory card and, about 800 shots with fresh batteries. This not a professional camera, if this is what you are looking for...you should at Nikon or Canon. I use this camera for traveling shooting at everything I see. So far, not reliable and, trouble free.

Reviews.Title: Basically a large point and shoot.
Reviews.Author: TJ "TJ Phoenix"
Reviews.Content: This camera is basically a large point and shoot camera that looks like a SLR camera. As a point and shoot camera it is not bad but it is fairly large.It might be better to get a smaller camera like the ELF that is almost as good and can fit in your pocket, it depends on your needs.This camera can zoom in better but you have to tote a larger camera.

Reviews.Title: importante
Reviews.Author: JOSE FELIX L-S "PUERTO LA CRUZ"
Reviews.Content: hello good morning greetings from Venezuela a coordial lords if they can be so kind as to send my article in a ampaque although not much, as I my Serbian shipping is very expensive in Venezuela thanks to my very kind attn. jose larahola buenos dias un coordial saludos desde venezuela señores si pueden ser tan amables de enviarme mi articulo en un ampaque que no pese mucho, ya que me mi servio de envio es muy costoso en venezuela para mi gracias muy amables atte. jose lara

Reviews.Title: S2550
Reviews.Author: David "DipsiDoodle"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use - like a point and shoot but with a lot more features.The burst mode is great for taking action shots.  There are so many options I can always find one to suit the task.Zoom is fast, colors are true and image sharp.

Reviews.Title: May be disappointed
Reviews.Author: dimitrilopez
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera 2 weeks ago, 12mpx- POS!!!, had cheap Canon cameras making better pictures, a waist of money, on low light conditions makes better pictures than in good light conditions, looks like a professional camera an feels like one- but- doesn't work like one. Automatic mode-the one you may probably will use for it's simplicity is the one in charge of poor quality picture. Waisted good moments, now have to retake the same pictures and spend extra time. Pictures very grainy. Will return the camera.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Shots!
Reviews.Author: Christine A. Rasmussen
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes. I own a Fuji FinePix S7000, a 6 MP bought six years ago. Its images on the "fine" (12 MP) setting are extremely crisp, clear and suitable for enlarging into posters while retaining crispness. But I developed a fine hand tremor, and without a tripod, the camera became useless to me.  I thought this FinePix S2550 would be the answer to my blurring problem.Unfortunately, this camera SUCKS!  Its images are very blurry and do not compare to the 10 MP Panasonic DMC-TZ5 Lumix I bought to overcome my tremor problem.  That little Lumix is actually capable of producing nearly sharp, clear pictures, but has shutter lag and doesn't give as detailed images as my old Fuji FinePix.  This Fuji FinePix S2550 12 MP seems like it would have been good in that it has the ability to manually set aperature and shutter speed, and have no shutter lag, unlike the Lumix, and that's why I wanted it.  But I couldn't believe how horrible the resolution is!  My Fuji S7000, combined with my occasional fine tremor, shoots comparably extremely clear, sharp images, unlike this new Fuji model.If Fuji's new technology has become so unreliable, as I've read negative reviews on its cousin, the 1800, which is essentially the same camera w/out HDMI output, I am no longer confident in Fuji's ability to come out with reliably superior cameras I had come to love in the past.  The love affair is over, and I will never own another Fuji.  I don't like reading some reviews which are positive along with some reviews that are negative.  That's not a good sign.I am soooo disappointed.  Now I have to go through the inconvenience of having to return it!CR

ProductInfo.Features:
12.2-megapixel, 1/2.3-inch CCD for photo-quality poster-sized prints
Fujinon 18x wide-angle optical zoom lens (28mm wide-angle to 504mm telephoto); Dual Image Stabilization
Capture movies in HD quality 720p resolution
3.0-inch high-contrast LCD and Electronic View Finder
Face Detection and Automatic Red-eye Removal; Smile and Blink Detection
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix S2550 12.2 MP Digital Camera with 18x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 3-Inch LCD
